name: Trivia Challenge 4U Quiz | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: Swedish actress Britt Ekland was married to which member of 'The Goon Show'?
Which was not a forename of J.R.R. Tolkien the British author of 'Lord of the Rings' (1954-1955) who was born in Bloemfontein, South Africa in 1888?
Captain Matthew Webb became the first person to swim the English Channel in 1875. Which swimming stroke did he use to swim from Dover to Calais?
In which country was Audrey Hepburn born?
What is actor Stewart Granger's real name?
The star of the film 'Genevieve' (1953) and actress wife of Rex Harrison, how old was Kay Kendall when she died?
questions.explanation:
33 years old.

	She died in 1959 of leukaemia.

questions.text: Which planet was discovered in 1781 by Sir William Herschel and originally named Georgius Sidus after King George III of Great Britain?
Montreal was officially established under its original name of ... on 6th May 1642?
Florian is the patron saint of ... ?
Who was the English physicist who built the first moving-coil galvanometer and the first practical electromagnet?
How is Welsh-born John Rowlands better known, as he took his famous name from a man who befriended him in America?
Who became the first heavyweight boxer to win the world title as a result of disqualification?
questions.explanation:
Max Schmeling.

	Jack Sharkey of America was disqualified in the fourth round for a foul against the German in 1930.

questions.text: Where was the first nuclear power station to be opened on June 27th 1954?
What was the name of the submarine that torpedoed the Argentinian battleship 'General Belgrano' during the Falklands War in 1982?
When was 'Advance Australia Fair' adopted as the Australian national anthem?
What was the name of the American aviator who made the first American coast-to-coast flight in 21 hours, 19 minutes in 1922?
Killer general practitioner Harold Shipman was jailed for life for murdering fifteen female patients and of forging a will. Where in Greater Manchester was he the murderous doctor for?
questions.explanation:
Hyde.

	He was convicted by jury at Preston crown court on January 31st 2000.

questions.text: Which of the following is a patron saint of housewives?
questions.explanation:
Martha.

	Martha is patron saint for many professions connected to the home; hotel keepers; maids; manservants; and laundry workers. The Feast day is 29th July.  Anne also has patronage of homemakers.

questions.text: Who was the English mathematician and inventor of the slide rule?
Who was the first rock star to perform in Russia with a concert in Leningrad which was totally sold out and ended with the Beatles' hit 'Back in the USSR'?
